title: Modify Existing Product design for DFM for Educational Space Product
snippet:
Quest For Space has developed a exciting educational platform that allows students Kindergarten through High School around the world to conduct science experiments aboard the International Space Station (www.questforspace.com).  We are a non-profit organizations that seeks to inspire the next generation of entrepreneurs and innovators by providing unique opportunities for students in the area of STEM education.

We have run Alpha and Beta pilots and are now ready to commercialize our platform and open it up to the world.  Part of our package is a "ground unit" which is essentially a replica of what we have flying on the ISS.  This allows students to set up their experiments and collect data on earth that they can compare with the experiment they also run on the ISS. Your task would be to modify our existing design to decrease material and assembly costs and increased production capacity.  The design changes will be agreed on by both the client and freelancer.  Attached is a picture of the current ground unit design.  CAD models will also be provided.   

A qualified freelancer will have experience in CAD modeling, Injection Molding, DFM, and manufacturing.  

There is also potentially more work for any freelancers who proves his/her skills, adherence to our schedule, and work ethic.
